text: Widely Applicable Information Criterion (WAIC) calculated : $$WAIC = -2 \times (lppd - p_{waic})$$ : \(lppd = \sum_{=1}^N \log(\frac{1}{S} \sum_{s=1}^S \exp(log\_lik_{}))\) log pointwise predictive density \(p_{waic} = \sum_{=1}^N \text{var}(log\_lik_{})\) effective number parameters WAIC Algorithm: lpd (log pointwise predictive density): observation \(\), compute \(\log(\text{mean}(\exp(\text{log\_lik}_i)))\) across MCMC samples p_waic: observation \(\), compute \(\text{var}(\text{log\_lik}_i)\) across MCMC samples elpd_waic: \(\text{lpd}_i - \text{p\_waic}_i\) observation waic: \(-2 \times \sum \text{elpd\_waic}_i\)

title: Calculate WAIC with Standard Errors for a Because Model ‚Äî because_waic
text: Standard errors WAIC calculated using pointwise contributions: $$SE(WAIC) = \sqrt{N \times \text{var}(waic_i)}$$ \(waic_i = -2 \times (lppd_i - p_{waic,})\).
